snippet: In “The Round House” Louise Erdrich takes us back to the North Dakota Ojibwe reservation, the backdrop of many of her earlier novels, and examines a brutal assault and its aftermath.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book The Round House, by Louise Erdrich.
lead_paragraph: In “The Round House” Louise Erdrich takes us back to the North Dakota Ojibwe reservation, the backdrop of many of her earlier novels, and examines a brutal assault and its aftermath.

headline.seo: ‘The Round House,’ Louise Erdrich’s New Novel
headline.main: Ambushed on the Road to Manhood
headline.print_headline: Ambushed On the Road To Manhood
